intro: Linanthus maricopensis, commonly known as the Maricopa linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, thriving in full sun. It has slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that help reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
